snippet: The lifting of gasoline subsidies by the government of President Omar Hassan al-Bashir prompted the latest protest, along with deaths and a crackdown on the news media.
abstract: Sudanese government says that the worst week of violent unrest that central Sudan has seen in years has resulted in the arrests of 700 people, along with many deaths and an unprecedented crackdown on the news media; trigger for latest protests was the lifting of gasoline subsidies by Pres Omar Hassan al-Bashir's government.
lead_paragraph: The lifting of gasoline subsidies by the government of President Omar Hassan al-Bashir prompted the latest protest, along with deaths and a crackdown on the news media.

headline.main: Unrest in Central Sudan Leads to Arrests of 700
headline.print_headline: Unrest in Central Sudan Leads to Arrests of 700
